intro: Nephrodium rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed nephroid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often in wetlands or along stream banks. Its reddish stems and inconspicuous flowers make it distinctive within its habitat. Nephrodium rufescens plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
